Hey! Trying to understand `degree_commitment`. 
Didn't find anything besides validation in the spec 
```
    assert (
        bls.Pairing(body_summary.degree_proof, G2_SETUP[0])
        == bls.Pairing(body_summary.commitment.point, G2_SETUP[-body_summary.commitment.length])
    )
```
Is my logic correct: 
1. If the data has `k` points then the polynomial `p(x)` would be of degree `< k`
2. Max polynomial degree is `N`
3. To prove the `p(x)` degree `<k` we are committing to polynomial `q(x) = p(x) * x^(N - k)` (`q(x)` degree would be `<N`)
4. If `p(x)` degree is `>=k` then the above commitment is impossible as  the resulting `q(x)` would have degree `>N` (above max degree)

<@!555483069038198827> have I correctly reverse engineered the logic?
